name: 4-(4-methoxybenzylidene)-2-phenyl-1,3-oxazol-5(4H)-one
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3922
Reason: 1,3-oxazole ring with a methoxybenzylidene linkage, which introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential. The methoxybenzylidene linkage also introduces additional molecular weight, which raises the melting point. The presence of two phenyl groups contributes to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +20°C per group, totaling +40°C. The methoxy group introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, which raises the melting point by approximately +5°C. The oxazole ring introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, which raises the melting point by approximately +20°C.
